description: [UNAIDS] GENEVA -- The United States Secretary of State, Marco Rubio, has approved an ''Emergency Humanitarian Waiver'', which will allow people to continue accessing HIV treatment funded by the US across 55 countries worldwide. More than 20 million people living with HIV, representing two-thirds of all people living with HIV receiving treatment globally, are directly supported by the United States President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) - the world's leading HIV initiative.
title: Africa: UNAIDS Welcomes the Decision By The US Secretary of State to Continue Life-Saving HIV Treatment And Convenes Partners to Assess and Mitigate Impacts On HIV Services

description: [Ethiopian Herald] -Experts weigh on continent's persistent resource mismanagement
title: Africa: Exchanging Gold for Aid - Africa's Dark Dilemma

description: [CAF] The draw for the TotalEnergies CAF Africa Cup of Nations (AFCON) TotalEnergies Morocco 2025 took place on Monday, 27 January 2 in Rabat, placing the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) in a tough Group D alongside Senegal, Benin, and Botswana.
title: Africa: TotalEnergies CAF Afcon Morocco 2025 - the Democratic Republic of Congo Is Ambitious

description: [The Conversation Africa] Artificial intelligence technologies, like chatbots, are attracting growing scrutiny for their voracious energy demands. However, energy consumption is only one part of their broader environmental impact.
title: Africa: AI Is Bad for the Environment, and the Problem Is Bigger Than Energy Consumption

description: [ISS] In response to a new wave of American insularity, European policymakers should pursue rapprochement with Africa.
title: Africa: Europe and Africa - Finding Love in a Time of Trump?

description: [MSF] In the most remote places in the world, people are daily battling diseases that many people may never have heard of. Called neglected tropical diseases, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially recognises 20 such conditions. They're called neglected diseases because diagnostics and treatments for them are overlooked by governments, pharmaceutical companies, and philanthropists.
title: Africa: Four Diseases You Have Probably Never Heard of

description: [WHO] The World Health Organization (WHO) congratulates Niger for having met the criteria for onchocerciasis elimination, making it the fifth country globally and the first country in Africa to be acknowledged by WHO for interrupting transmission of the parasite Onchocerca volvulus.
title: Africa: WHO Verifies Niger As the First Country in the African Region to Eliminate Onchocerciasis

description: [Capital FM] Nairobi -- The increasing availability of free or low-cost Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools has significantly contributed to the rising cases of biometric fraud across Africa, according to a new report by Smile ID.
title: Africa: AI-Driven Fraud Fuels Surge in Biometric Scams in Africa - Report

description: [CAF] Numbers you might not know. This week we focus the spotlight on the TotalEnergies CAF Africa Cup of Nations hosts Morocco, where the draw was conducted on Monday.
title: Africa: Stat Attack - Morocco

description: [VOA] Washington -- The State Department on Wednesday sought to clarify President Donald Trump's order to freeze and review foreign development aid after the top U.S. diplomat blunted some of the chaos that ensued with an emergency order that could shield the world's largest HIV program from the 90-day funding freeze.
title: Africa: State Department Says Trump Froze Foreign Aid to 'Root Out Waste'

description: [UN News] United Nations Deputy Secretary-General Amina Mohammed highlighted on Tuesday the critical need for collaborative and urgent action to achieve the ambitious goal of bringing electricity to 300 million Africans by 2030.
title: Africa: From Policy to Progress - UN Deputy Chief Mohammed Outlines Path for Africa's Clean Energy Transformation

description: [VOA] White House -- The Trump administration has ordered a three-month pause on almost all foreign development assistance pending a review to see what fits in with the president's "America First" policy. Aid groups and human rights watchdogs warn that the freeze will put countless lives around the world at risk.
title: Africa: Trump Administration Freezes Foreign Development Assistance

description: [Greenpeace] Kinshasa, 29 January 2025 - Greenpeace Africa welcomes the creation of the Kivu to Kinshasa Green Corridor Reserve, an ambitious initiative to establish a vast protected area of more than 54,000 km², which will be dedicated to the conservation and sustainable management of natural resources. Felix Tshisekedi, President of the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC), made the announcement at the World Economic Forum in Davos on January 22nd 2025.
title: Africa: DRC Green Corridor Project - Greenpeace Africa Cautiously Welcomes 'World's Largest Forest Reserve', Urges Inclusive Approach

description: [spotlight] Following US President Donald Trump's decision to suspend foreign aid, President Cyril Ramaphosa can display great leadership by meeting with leaders of wealthy countries and convincing them to increase spending to support the health systems of poorer countries.
title: Africa: Stopping Health Funding in Africa Weakens America

description: [Afrobarometer] Nine out of 10 citizens express openness to cohabitation - as neighbours or married-in family members - with people of other ethnicities.
title: Africa: Africans Struggle With Interethnic Trust but Embrace Coexistence

description: [Africa Renewal] To manage rapid urbanization effectively, African cities must enhance fiscal strategies and broaden revenue sources.
title: Africa: Financial, Fiscal, and Budgetary Planning Crucial for African Cities
